concepts.name: Atom
concepts.definition: The smallest particle of an element that retains the identity and properties of that element, composed of a nucleus and surrounding electrons.

concepts.name: Dalton's Atomic Theory
concepts.definition: An early 19th-century theory stating that all matter is made of tiny, indestructible, and indivisible particles called atoms.

concepts.name: Modern Atomic Theory
concepts.definition: The current understanding that matter is composed of atoms, which are themselves made of smaller subatomic particles (protons, neutrons, and electrons), and that atoms of an element can exist as isotopes.

concepts.name: Subatomic Particle
concepts.definition: Particles that are smaller than an atom, primarily protons, neutrons, and electrons.

concepts.name: Proton
concepts.definition: A positively charged subatomic particle located in the nucleus of an atom.

concepts.name: Neutron
concepts.definition: A subatomic particle with no electrical charge (neutral) located in the nucleus of an atom.

concepts.name: Electron
concepts.definition: A negatively charged subatomic particle that occupies the space surrounding the nucleus of an atom.

concepts.name: Nucleus
concepts.definition: The central core of an atom, formed by a cluster of protons and neutrons, containing most of the atom's mass.

concepts.name: Atomic Number (Z)
concepts.definition: The number of protons in the nucleus of an atom, which uniquely identifies an element.

concepts.name: Mass Number (A)
concepts.definition: The total number of protons and neutrons in the nucleus of a single atom.

concepts.name: Isotope
concepts.definition: Atoms of the same element (having the same number of protons) that have different numbers of neutrons, and therefore different mass numbers.

concepts.name: Radioisotope
concepts.definition: An unstable isotope with a nucleus that spontaneously decays, releasing energy and subatomic particles in a process called radioactivity.

concepts.name: Periodic Table
concepts.definition: A systematic arrangement of elements in order of increasing atomic number, where elements with similar properties appear in the same vertical columns (groups).

concepts.name: Periodic Law
concepts.definition: The principle that the chemical and physical properties of the elements repeat in a regular, periodic pattern when they are arranged by increasing atomic number.

concepts.name: Energy Level
concepts.definition: Fixed, three-dimensional regions of space around an atomic nucleus where electrons are restricted to move. Electrons in lower energy levels are closer to the nucleus and have less energy.

concepts.name: Valence Electron
concepts.definition: An electron that occupies the outermost (highest) energy level of an atom and is responsible for the element's chemical properties and bonding behavior.

concepts.name: Lewis Structure
concepts.definition: A diagram that uses an element's atomic symbol to represent the nucleus and inner electrons, with dots placed around the symbol to represent the valence electrons.

concepts.name: Stable Octet
concepts.definition: A highly stable electron arrangement where the outermost energy level is completely filled with eight valence electrons (or two for elements in the first period).

concepts.name: Periodic Trend
concepts.definition: A regular pattern or predictable change in the properties of elements as you move across a period or down a group in the periodic table.

concepts.name: Atomic Radius
concepts.definition: A measure of the size of an atom, defined as the distance from its nucleus to the approximate outer boundary of its electron cloud.

concepts.name: Ion
concepts.definition: A charged particle formed when a neutral atom gains or loses one or more electrons.

concepts.name: Cation
concepts.definition: A positively charged ion that is formed when a neutral atom loses one or more electrons.

concepts.name: Anion
concepts.definition: A negatively charged ion that is formed when a neutral atom gains one or more electrons.

concepts.name: Ionization Energy
concepts.definition: The amount of energy required to remove an electron from a neutral atom, forming a positive ion (cation).

concepts.name: Electron Affinity
concepts.definition: A measure of the change in energy that occurs when an electron is added to a neutral atom, forming a negative ion (anion).
